intro: Dewildemania lancifolia, commonly known as the sharpleaf dewildemania, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, pointed leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of silvery hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange, typically blooming during the late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
